p: The same model has already been used to model changes of R e over time to realistically describe the epidemic dynamics of a viral infection of public health importance. For instance, peak of transmissibility (R e ~ 2) modelled through BDSKY in a Dengue virus outbreak in urban area of Brazil in March 2012 coincided with the observed peak in Dengue virus detection in blood-donor banks [ 76]; similarly, for Zika Virus BDSKY allowed to forecast an increase of R e in Florida (USA) in June 2016, before the first reports from Florida Department of Health [ 62].
